channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024120220
item.description:
Report E-2024120220

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-13T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 4, 2024, three (3) 5-gallon jugs of UN1760 were punctured and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all UN1760 from the site. All impacted materials and the damaged jugs were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120173
item.description:
Report E-2024120173

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-11T12:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-09
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 9, 2024, forty-five (45) 5-gallon pails of Wire & Mag Wheel Cleaner were crushed in transit and released approximately sixty (60) gallons of product to the trailer floor and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizers, absorbents, and hand tools to remove all spent product. All waste was containerized in sixteen (16) 55-gallon drums for disposal.
